TI: [Histochemical and morphometric evidence of the participation of dorsal hippocampal neurons in the antistress effect of melatonin].
AB: The epiphyseal hormone melatonin (0.1 mg/kg) does not influence the functional state of pyramidal neurons in the dorsal hippocamp of intact rats, but decreases the swimming-stress-induced activation of these neurons. Removal of the pineal gland increased the functional activity of neurons in the intact rats and potentiated the stress-induced histochemical and morphometric changes.
AD: Pharmacology Department, State Medical Academy, Ministry of Public Health of the Russian Federation, ul. Mira 310, Stavropol, 355024 Russia.
TT: Gistokhimicheskie i morfometricheskie dokazatel'stva uchastiia neironov dorsal'nogo gippokampa v antistressornom deistvii melatonina.
